threads.com:
/vmg/ is a place to discuss all types of mobile games, including both Android and iOS, phones and tablets. Please note that Nintendo and Sony handhelds are considered consoles, and that threads pertaining to those platforms and their gaming titles should be posted elsewhere.

Does this mean discussion of mobile games is banned on other video game boards? No! /vmg/ is just a separate board specifically focused on mobile games where discussions about your favorite games can thrive.

Please familiarize yourself with the rules and remember to use the spoiler function where appropriate!

Please note that, like /v/, "Generals"—long-term, one-after-the-other, recurring threads about a specific game are not permitted on /vmg/. Such threads belong on >>>/vg/

>>1046642
Titan Quest was great on fold 3. Gamepass streaming is awesome, but you need a gamepad for most games. Emulation (everything pre-ps3 era, gamepad recommended). I still have Asphalt Extreme and it works and looks great. NIKKE uses the screen well, huge advantage, similar to MOBA games like Mobile Legends or Wild Rift.

This phone may be utilized for serious gaming and that's the reason why I bought it, mostly for emulation, the entire ps2 library will last you a lifetime and that's just one of many console with high quality games.

Fold 3 have serious overheating issues with android games running at max settings. Emulation and streaming shouldn't cause it. I would recommend a cooler if you don't use it like a handheld and have a gamepad (elite 2 was my choice, for handheld it's gamesir or nothing sadly).

Blogposting now:
I found out the Methodical contract is great for soulstone farming. I wish I had event points to buy another one, so I'd fill it with Skill Boost +20% and one Proficiency piece and wouldn't regret shit. I need to start doing Hunt dungeons (for things like Skill Boost +30%).

Methodical (2x Mining) + Skill Boost and Proficiency (3x) + Many Arms (2x) = 12 times
times 5 for the highest level dungeons plus other less relevant bonus (so 6 or 7) - so 60~84
times whatever the base mining value is (35? so around 3k per click?)

With Lunatic we have more time saved, as it can be set so only Mining is used (without Ninjutsu and its following Blood Armor, so more free slots), and I suppose a full turn would take (at minimum) around 10 seconds. So 1 million soulstones per hour?? This is going to be my next goal.

I also found out now, late in the game, I could be using the protection (star) feature to sort out new lab and contract parts. So buying many contracts at once and cleaning the mess of repeated crap wouldn't be a huge pain in the ass.

I also successfully isolated an HP/Lv and HP Boost contract pieces into spare Inferno (non-mergeable effect) ones. It works as I guessed it would. And bought everything I thought I could use in the future with dark studies. The only thing I missed was buying another Methodical piece. Dunno how long it would take for it to be on sale for dried leaves.

>>1049605
>How much progress can I make in a month without spending money on the game?
Just by rushing straight through the townhalls you could even reach the last townhal in few months. There are 15 townhalls atm, you start at TH2. To upgrade to the next townhall the only requirement is to place all the buildings on your current townhall. Even if those buildings are all lvl1, if you have enough loot, you are free to upgrade. Essentially what I'm saying is that you can play at your own pace and stil have access to whatever newest feature was added with the latest townhall.
A F2P player has essentially two ways to max:
1)For new players the usual advice is to max everything at their current townhall before upgrading because this way they get enough time to learn everyting. The main problem is the time that it will take you to accomplish this. This is not impossible, it all depends on how much you will stick with the game, how much time you can play etc. With each new townhall all the previous get cost and time reductions for upgrades, in fact you will get through low townhalls extremely fast, and trust me when I say that I was not like that before. The main issue are high townhalls to the point when upgrade time just doesn't make sense (we are talking 15+ days here).
2)Rushing. I won't go in details here because it requires a long explanation of the main idea that people usually ignore (and literally nobody will ever read it). I will just say that you focus on your offense and planning upgrades in a certain way, don't just rush in a dumb way. People usually don't even consider going this route and there's a debate to this day whether this an altenative or not. I think it is and allows to max faster and save a lot of time you would just waste otherwise, but if done incorrectly it will become a very unpleasant experience very fast and it will suck to recover.

>>1044938
I haven't looked at them yet, but ATK buffs are pretty whatever in the game.
I'm pretty sure damage is calculated with def being factored into ATK. As in if you have 4 times atk vs def instead of 2 times, you deal double damage. So to get the same effect with atk buffs that you'd get with def debuffs, you'd need a LOT more atk buffs.

I dunno exact formulas, but it's pretty obvious that def debuffs get really fucking broken once you reach a certain threshold, likewise if you go up against relatively weak enemies, you don't even need that.
Last score attack I fucked up once and used wolf girls skills the wrong order, so only 3 tiles were absorbed instead of 5. She still had the 30% amp world fragment, and obviously her crash def down, so the difference is like -4000 vs. -5400 ish def down. Like that I didn't even deal half the damage, and instead of a comfy 2 turn experience with tons of overkill, I needed either 4 full turns or maybe even 5.

So yeah, ATK isn't unimportant, but a 10k buff does literally nothing if you can't massively shred defense. We always had Musashi for extreme crash damage multiplier and atk buffs (~8k) and the fire loli for insane amounts of slayers, but while they definitely deal more damage, it's not nearly having as much impact as massive def down. I think before atk buffs would compared, they'd need to be like 30k-40k. I kinda hope they actually change the def bullshit. After all it's going both ways. Def buffs are broken as shit.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com: how do you guys grind in this game?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1046148
I just simply do hexes. There's a method of doing them you gotta learn though in order to not have a full inventory 100% of the time while still doing all hexes that drop all the good stuff like material shells and 3 star kit shells. Most basic rule is to do all the blue hexes first, sell all the trash shells you get from them, and then do the red, yellow, and 3 area blue hexes(some 2 area hexes also drop good stuff so I remember them.) Once you get the hang of doing this, you won't miss any of the important shells that drop from those hexes due to a full inventory. Your battery stock will increase quicker than you are using them too. One thing to note is I also discard any S gear shells too since I have no use for them other than the medals you get from selling personal gear but I find that gear medal shells are more efficient. However, if I know I'm going to end my run soon I leave S gear shells in my inventory and analyze them last before I close the game.
Another thing to mention is farming for quality blue gear to +99 your gear. For this I analyze any regular 2 star blue gear shells I get, as it is more efficient then analyzing regular 3 star blue gear shells. Also I check the map completion rewards for the glowing blue gear shells that are guaranteed to give quality blue gear. You may get an upward of 4 of these shells sometimes from fully completing maps. Usually I pay gold (you'll have plenty of gold if you are farming hexes constantly and I almost never run out unless I upgrade gear) to skip maps until I'm on a map that gives them as a reward for map completion, but I don't skip the purple background maps that give more scout points than normal maps do.
I'm not sure I mentioned everything but this is a gist of what I do.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1042998
>I meant the other way round, like that anon that butts into these threads telling you to emulate Heroes 2 for a better experience than any mobile game can provide, etc.
Oh, I see. I had that happen to me when I recommended mobile games to someone asking for them and they essentially said "No thanks, I'm going back to emulating console games." It's equally disingenuous.
>What? Games with good touch controls schemes are downright untranslatable to mice or gamepads if you ask me.
Not necessarily. Take this game for example:
https://store.steampowered.com/app/1582730/Abyss_Memory_Fallen_Angel_and_the_Path_of_Magic/
Now this is a game that was clearly designed to be played with a stylus rather than a mouse, nothing else can achieve that level of precision. It doesn't have touch screen compatibility in its Switch port either; you have to draw the paths with a Joy-Con. This means that the optimal way to play this game would be to use a capacitive stylus on a desktop monitor (because a laptop lid will shake too much) with touch screen compatibility.

Therefore, mobile games with touch controls, such as Cut the Rope, should also be feasibly playable if not better under the same conditions.
>Unless you're talking about all those mobile ports of action games
They don't have to be Action games; it applies to ALL mobile games because nearly all of them are enhanced via gamepad support with custom keybind mapping, a larger display, and more.
The only mobile games that are exempt from this are the ones that actually capitalize on the fact that the player is on a smartphone, such as Pokemon Go.
